position: Legislative Assistant and Professional Staff Member
key_responsibilities: designing and preparing congressional hearings
working with multiple stakeholders to design legislative solutions to address complex national policy concerns
writing statements and speeches
conducting legal and factual research
drafting memoranda
ensuring Government Operations priorities are reflected in appropriations and defense authorization bills
engaging the Chairman’s constituents and ensuring their needs and priorities are reflected in Committee oversight and legislation
leading oversight initiatives
requirements: interest in public service
expertise in some of the areas described above
the ability to work closely with a team and remain entrepreneurial
superior attention to detail
work well under pressure
be self-motivated
possess excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: Drafting legislation and amendments and advancing them through various legislative vehicles
Preparing hearing binders and questions for witnesses for Homeland Security Committee hearings
Drafting talking points, vote recommendations and other materials
Monitoring and analyzing legislative developments, committee proceedings, news stories and other relevant info
Representing the Member in meetings with constituents and stakeholders
requirements: proven record of proposing legislation, developing amendments, and leading on letters
ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
strong organizational and time management skills
excellent written and verbal communication skills
a keen attention to detail

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
serving as project manager for the diversity report and, where necessary, directing and coordinating activities of external consultants
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
expertise using relevant software
customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
extensive computer skills, including data input

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: managing the intake and dissemination of requests sent to the House Diversity and Inclusion team, including, but not limited to, resume review and referrals
providing administrative support to the House Diversity and Inclusion team
drafting and reviewing correspondence for accuracy and completeness
managing the day to day of the office (managing supplies, office vendors, interfacing with external and internal vendors, answering phones, processing mail, etc.)
maintaining team calendar and coordinating all internal staff meetings/ events
managing the calendars and scheduling all appointments for the Candidate Services team, including scheduling resume reviews, mock interviews and exit interviews
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent level of experience) and relevant experience in an administrative role
experience supporting a team in a fast-paced environment
detail oriented

knowledge of technology and office equipment and willingness to learn new information systems and software; proficiency in the use of computer applications and Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Word), an Internet Quorum program highly preferred

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
position: Professional Staffers of Member and Candidate Services
key_responsibilities: corresponding and providing direct support to House employing offices in the areas of diversity and inclusion training, consulting and applicant placement
corresponding and providing direct support to candidates by providing applicant coaching and preparedness services
establishing relationships with House employing offices
determining Member office staffing needs through initial assessment and ongoing meetings
driving increased participation in programs and services
creating and maintaining diversity and inclusion resource materials (diversity and inclusion handbook, best practice documents, etc.) for dissemination to House employing offices
database management for candidate selection and placement
conducting initial assessment for applicants including resume reviews and advising
conducting mock interviews and exit interviews for applicants
representing the Office at internal and external engagements as needed
requirements: Bachelor’s degree and a combination of knowledge and experience in diversity and inclusion issues in the public and/or private sectors
being a self-starter with a history of working collaboratively with a diverse cross section of stakeholders
experience in building consensus and gaining support around challenging issues
experience with program management and implementation
experience with computers and working knowledge of Word, Excel, and social media
management experience in hiring, and supervision of staff

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: developing/producing content across multiple platforms including photography, videos, infographics, and other creative executions for Member offices, events, trainings and research products
managing the Office of Diversity and Inclusion website, newsletter, and social media platforms
repurposing existing content and finding opportunities for new content
supporting the House D&I program with writing and implementation as needed
performing other duties and projects as assigned
requirements: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Digital Communications, Publishing, or Content Production
strong knowledge of social media and content trends, and emerging technologies and platforms
working knowledge of digital and social media metrics
background in photography and video production and editing and a strong focus on storytelling
experience with social media community management
excellent writing skills
design knowledge
extensive experience handling multiple projects from ideation to final delivery
knowledge and understanding of Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud apps including Premiere Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator, Media Encoder and After Effects

office: House Financial Services Committee Majority staff
position: Deputy Communications Director or Press Secretary
key_responsibilities: developing press releases, talking points and written materials
developing content for the Committee’s website and digital platforms
developing and maintaining relationships with national, local, political and minority-focused media
proactively pitching members of the press on Committee initiatives
requirements: prior Capitol Hill or advocacy experience and knowledge of the legislative process
strong oral, writing and proofreading skills
a positive approach to a busy and fast-paced work environment

key_responsibilities: representing the Member of Congress in the community
maintaining positive relationships with constituents, other local elected officials, and business and community leaders and organizations

handling constituent casework in their assigned issue areas, which includes answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, communicating with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal and local agencies
requirements: ability to work quickly in a high pressure environment
meet very tight deadlines
exceptional writing and organizational skills

office: Active, hard-working Democratic member of Illinois congressional delegation
key_responsibilities: planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio
working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message
handling daily media inquiries
maintaining relationships with national, Chicago, and local reporters
writing talking points and press releases
pitching op-eds
overseeing paid constituent outreach (franking) budget
managing website
producing videos and social media content
planning and promoting press events in DC and the district
requirements: previous communications and/or Capitol Hill experience
strong writing and oral communication skills
the ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
be team players with a good sense of humor

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials
requirements: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
solid grasp of House procedures and a deep understanding of relevant policy
excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team
excellent oral and written communications skills
highly organized
meet deadlines
manage multiple projects
flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district
